biography.content: Dr. Christian spent his first 10 years in the electronics industry at Nortel in Belleville, Ontario where he ran a materials lab and won several awards, including three Presidentâ€™s Awards for his environmental work.  For the last thirteen years he has been at Research In Motion/Blackberry where he is currently the Director of Materials Interconnect Lab.  His specific areas of interest include solderability, corrosion and environmental compliance.  He is a member of ASM and SMTA.  He also sits on several of the standards committees of the IPC, where he chairs the Corrosion of Metal Surfaces Task Group.  He is an active stamp collector.

keyword.content: inorganic chemistry, solderability, corrosion, lead free solder, contamination
